summary: This is a chain of forwarded emails from September 2019 between FBI personnel discussing potential compensation for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails inquire about whether victims who recently disclosed abuse can apply for compensation through the Office for Victims of Crime (OVS) and mention the need for a letter from a prosecutor.

events.title: Inquiry about Epstein victim compensation
events.description: An FBI agent from the New York Field Office emails an OVS representative asking if victims who recently disclosed abuse by Epstein can still apply for compensation.

events.title: Forwarded request to SDNY
events.description: FBI personnel forward the victim compensation inquiry to the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for assistance.

keyFacts: The emails discuss potential compensation for victims of Jeffrey Epstein through the Office for Victims of Crime (OVS).
Victims in the NYC area had recently disclosed abuse that occurred years prior, prompting the inquiry about eligibility for compensation.
Compensation coverage may be possible if a letter from a prosecutor (DA or AUSA) states they would have prosecuted the case if it had been brought in a timely manner.
The OVS representative expresses anger about 'what happened over the weekend,' likely referring to Epstein's death in August 2019.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI Victim Services Division, New York Field Office, and the Southern District of New York regarding victim support.
